title: ISic003557. An antiquarian 'forgery'
body:
1Θ(εοῖ)ς · Κα(ταχθονίοις) ·
2ἰδίῳ συμβίῳ [. 4.]
3ὃς ἔζησ[εν] ἔτη [..] ΟΓ
4τὸν μνημόσυνον
5ἐποίησε εὐνοίας
6καὶ μνήμης ἕνεκεν
7Ἰουλία Γλμικὴ Ἰχνδτι

l.7 reg., orig. Γλμικὴ | reg., orig. Ἰχνδτι

1ΘΣΚΑ
2ΙΔΙΩΣΥΜΒΙΩ[····]
3ΟΣΕΖΗΣ[..]ΕΤΗ[··]ΟΓ
4ΤΟΝΜΝΗΜΟΣΥΝΟΝ
5ΕΠΟΙΗΣΕΕΥΝΟΙΑΣ
6ΚΑΙΜΝΗΜΗΣΕΝΕΚΕΝ
7ΙΟΥΛΙΑΓΛΜΙΚΗΙΧΝΔΤΙ

l.7 reg., orig. Γλμικὴ | reg., orig. Ἰχνδτι

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Kaibel and Filippi, with suggested restorations of SEG; prioritising Kaibel's transcription of the manuscript tradition.

translation

commentary

As Korhonen lucidly details, the inscription is one of a series of late 18th century local antiquarian forgeries, constructed on the basis of existing texts, principally those to be found in the 1769 first edition of the corpus of Torremuzza. Kaibel classed the entire series already as forgeries in IG XIV.

bibliography

  • 14.0025* https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 52.0902 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • Filippi 2002 75 no. 10/7 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001991
  • Filippi 2005 67 no. 10/7 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002296
  • Korhonen 2017 198 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001484
